Award.AwardTitle: Support for U.S. High Energy Physicists to Attend 46th Rencontres de Moriond Conference, La Thiule, Italy, March 13-27, 2011
Award.AbstractNarration: This grant provides partial support for young physicists to attend either of the two sequential 46th Rencontres de Moriond conferences to be held in La Thuile, Italy: (1) Electroweak Interactions and Unified Theories (March 13-20, 2011) and (2) QCD and High Energy Hadronic Interactions (March 20-27, 2011). Moriond meetings in 2011 are transitional since, besides the experimental results to be reported from U.S.-based CDF, D0, PHENIX and STAR, increasing importance will be placed on the preparation for the LHC physics and commissioning of the detectors, in which the U.S. scientists play a major role. With LHC experiments being in the full commissioning mode with the first LHC beam data and vast amount of cosmics collected with the fully operational detectors in their underground experimental halls, one expects an increased number of LHC talks at the 2011 Moriond conference. Consequently, the 2010 Moriond remains a unique and excellent opportunity to both advertise the impressive U.S. science program in particle physics and at the same time to give our most talented young scientists extra visibility by allowing them to deliver their latest results at these two major European forums. Special efforts will be made to encourage women and minorities to participate.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project provided partial support for US scientists to attend Rencontres de Moriond Conferences on: (1) ELECTROWEAK INTERACTIONS AND UNIFIED THEORIES, (2) QCD AND HADRONIC INTERACTIONS. The 45th Rencontres de Moriond Conference on ELECTROWEAK INTERACTIONS AND UNIFIED THEORIES will be held in La Thuile, Italy, March 13-20, 2011. The 45th Rencontres de Moriond on QCD AND HIGH HADRONIC INTERACTIONS will also be held in La Thuile, Italy, March 20-27, 2011.

The purpose of the Rencontres de Moriond is to discuss recent findings and new ideas in physics, in a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere. The meeting is intended to promote fruitful collaboration between various communities and institutes by bringing together a small number of scientists in inspiring surroundings. The meeting is intended to promote fruitful collaboration between experimentalists and theorists and between various institutions by bringing together a limited number of physicists and astrophysicists in beautiful and inspiring surroundings. 

Moriond conferences are among a few major venues in our field. In fact, most of the current experiments target Moriond as the first conference of the year where new results are going to be shown. The Moriond meetings, despite their relatively small size, are as prestigious and highly-recognized conferences as the major summer venues in our field, e.g., Lepton-Photon or ICHEP. In fact, Moriond conferences are the most important winter conferences in particle physics.

This partial support provided by the NSF grant allowed many young US high energy physicists to participate in these conferences which is very important for their career development. This also allowed US to capitalize on the recent particle physics successes by presenting new important results at the major European fora.
